newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Gilt-Edged says gold resource raised 38 pct.
newsitem.headline: Gilt-Edged says gold resource raised 38 pct.

text.p: Gold explorer Gilt-Edged Mining NL said on Friday that an independent reassessment has shown a 38 percent increase in contained gold resources at its Siberia prospect in Western Australia.

The company said the reassessment by geostatistical consultant Geoval showed an indicated and inferred resource of 4.2 million tonnes of ore, grading 2.9 grams per tonne gold, containing 390,000 ounces of gold.
The latest estimate represents an increase of 107,000 ounces on the previous figure announced earlier this month, Gilt-Edged said.
Drilling is scheduled to resume this weekend on a second phase of a A$4.1 million exploration programme, the company said.
Exploration will include drilling to extend the existing resource areas, it said.
